member.summary: Gets all memory locations with any associated debug information

member.summary: Removes all debug information associated with the given address

member.summary: Gets all symbols

member.summary: Retrieves the status of the skip flag

member.summary: Retrieves the value of the interrupt address register

member.summary: Retrieves the value of the extra register

member.summary: Represents a file which is open in the workspace

member.summary: Causes the textual contents of the file to be saved to disk

member.summary: Gets the underlying file object (represents the file in the project)

member.summary: Gets the absolute path of the file

member.name: P:Devkit.Interfaces.IOpenFile.IsCurrentFile
member.summary: Indicates whether the file is the currently-selected file

member.summary: Gets or sets a flag controlling whether the file is open and remains open

member.summary: Gets the display title of the file

member.name: P:Devkit.Interfaces.IOpenFile.IsDirty
member.summary: Gets or sets the dirty flag (indicating whether the file has unsaved changes or not). May be set by editors which manually save non-textual content of a file.

member.summary: Gets or sets the textual content of the file

member.summary: Registers a new device to handle hardware interrupts, queries

member.summary: Unregisters an already-registered hardware device

member.summary: Retrieves the number of hardware devices associated with the system

member.name: T:Devkit.Interfaces.IEmulatedSystem
member.summary: Represents an emulated system and its components

member.summary: Causes instruction execution to be blocked (or unblocked)

member.name: M:Devkit.Interfaces.IEmulatedSystem.StartCycleTimer(System.Int64,Devkit.Interfaces.IHardwareDevice,System.Object)
member.summary: Causes emulation to be delayed by the given number of cycles, before notifying the hardware device specified (via the CycleDelayCompleted method)

member.name: M:Devkit.Interfaces.IEmulatedSystem.StartTimer(System.Double,Devkit.Interfaces.IHardwareDevice,System.Object)
member.summary: Causes emulation to be delayed by the given number of seconds, before notifying the hardware device specified (via the CycleDelayCompleted method). Cycle-accurate.

member.summary: Fired when the system is reset completely

member.summary: Retrieves the memory controller for the system
